intro: Bidens mathewsii, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Bidens mathewsii is known for its hardy nature and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
